title: Spiritually motivated
review: Parmarth Nikaten is very famous place of Rishikesh for spiritual activity. Yoga, Ganga darshan,Ganga Arati are main attractions. Situated on the left bank of Ganga river. Some years ago Lord Shiva statue is constructed along or in the deeply submerged area of left bank  creates beautiful view or spiritual view for meditation or worship.

title: Visited Ashram during Rishikesh Stay
review: The ashram is the largest in Rishikesh and it works for many social causes including cleaning of Ganges river under the Namami Ganges initiative. The Ashram also has around 1000 rooms for visitors and if someone wants to stay here then they can send in the request by applying online on the ashram's website.

title: If you're in Rishikesh it's a must really!
review: Come here to watch the sun setting on the Ganga river - it is simply incredible and a fantastic way to be welcomed (and also say goodbye) to Rishikesh.

title: Nice Place to visit
review: One of the best peaceful place in Rishikesh, everyone should go there for yoga and meditation. this place is famous globally

title: Amazing experience
review: Very spiritual and interesting chanting on Ganga river side. We spend amazing evening and would like to come back.

title: Quiet and peaceful
review: The Aarti here is very beautiful, less number of people attend here, so you will be able to attend it in a better way.

title: Peace place
review: Excellent get up. Very sombre ambience. Kitchen serves very tasty food at very affordable rate to everyone. Rooms are very clean, modestly decorated and priced reasonably. Booking done on line. Popular among tourists both National and International. Gangs artist in the evening is a real crowd puller. Must stay while in Rishikesh. Provision stores are available with good stock.

title: Definitely a place to visit
review: The temple is on the side of the Ganges and is a must see. It is full of mythology and Some great statues. It is locatied next to the Ganges and is in a busy areia where there is a lot of action going on.

title: evening aarti
review: the most remarkable experience of visiting rishikesh is the evening ganga aarti on parmath niketan temple ghats.

title: Very good
review: Situated on the bank of river Ganga ,this is a famous spot for the famous Ganga Aarti . Quite serene and peaceful spot . A few good temples here are very nice . Lots of activities keep on happening here . A must visit

title: Don't miss it!
review: Lovely gardens, quiet clean nicely maintained. Across from it is a huge Shiva sculpture sitting in front of Ganges River. Every evening they hold the Ganga Aarti. Very inspiring and spiritual. Enjoy!

title: Gorgeous!
review: A huge highlight! Don't miss this and the grandious Shiva statue who sits majestically in front of Holy Ganga river! In the evening they hold Ganga Aarti which I also recommend. Enjoy!

title: Stayed for a day
review: Awesome place. Room were not that great but it was as expected . Good to see solar panel were installed and without electricity you get hot water. Nice clean place. Canteen offers great food with optimum price.

title: Simply wow
review: One need to attend the evening Aarti of Parmarth Niketan performed by all.Its very quiet place and the disciples of it sing the Various songs .Its very spiritual.It has a statue of Shiva in between the Ganga...... They have a statur of Hanuman as well.

title: Went for the aarti...was disappointed.
review: After seeing the Triveni Ghat aarti, we wanted to try somewhere different. The Temple sits right on the ganges with some impressive statues. We sat off to the side and got there early only to realise all the action happened right in the middle where we couldnt see anything. Go to Triveni Ghat if you want to see a beautiful immersive and inclusive aarti.

title: Well kept ashram, worth visiting
review: A very calm and serene place. You can also stay here for a unique and enriching experience. Bookings should be done in advance and the min stay period is 7 days or more. The ashram offers a range of activities during your stay - seva, yoga and meditation. Please do not use the premises as a cheaper alternative for your other travel plans. The Ganga aarti is performed by the students of this ashram... The aarti is a once in a life time experience.

title: Prayer ceremony by Ganges
review: I have attended an aarti ceremony, at the Indian holy river Ganges. While it was entrancing, unusual and something to experience once, it was way too long (almost like Christian Chrismas Mass, but longer-2 hours), filled with incomprehensible (to Hindi non-speaker) endless singing and chanting. While I respect that some visitors and most natives find the experience inspiring, for me it was only once in my life time. I will not be attending another one.

title: Iconic Rishikesh
review: I loved visiting this Ashram.

title: Beautiful but COLD
review: Stayed at Parmath Niketan Feb 4 to Feb 8.  Beautiful grounds, excellent Aarti, room with view of Ganga.  But room was cold and drafty and dimly lit. Not particularly clean, but hey it's an ashram.  Shower has NO PRESSURE at all- hard to wash hair, took forever even for a basic shower. If someone flushes- you get scalded.  Upside?  did not run out of hot water.

title: A place for prayers n peace for soul on banks of river Ganges
review: Just One needs to be there ....can not be explained by words ....The blessings of Maa Ganges is what one needs to be here...The Aarti is most pleasant and people of Parmarth Ashram have very nice and simple management during Aarti...one should be well on time ...

title: Go to the ceremony
review: The ceremony is quite magical and it even had friends kids who were visiting quiet and still. I recommend to visit for ceremony, during other times it’s interesting with its different statues and stories, but ceremony is definitely the highlight!

title: Ganga Aarti @ Parmath Niketan
review: I attended Parmath Niketan's Ganga Aarti last week. It is different from the Triveni Ghat one.

title: MUST VISIT
review: Open Arti each day at 5pm & Sat Sang inside the ashram at 6pm by an amazing wise woman (originally from CA) - RECOMENDED HIGHLY

title: Temple
review: Har har mahadev is the chant that greets you when you visit most of the temples in hardiwar and Rishikesh. Famous temple.

title: Divine place to be here
review: Its a nice and divine place, If you are visiting rishikesh then its a must visit place. Here you can also enjoy ganga aarti

title: Great Ganges Aarti and Pooja
review: A one hour pooja and aarti of maa Ganges.

title: Beautiful place.
review: Amazing place. The arti was just mesmerizing. The priests even give you to hold the arti plate. A must visit for a great arti darshan and bhajans

title: Interactive Ganga Arati
review: Loved the Ganga arati. It was no frills,  interactive and done within a reasonable time. Arranged by the Ashram resident it is  much more easy to connect with emotionally. Sat quietly. Held the diyas and floated lamps.

title: Great Experience
review: This was on my list of things to do in Rishikesh and I will encourage any tourist to visit this Temple.

title: Beautiful Ashram -Ganga Arati here is a must to be experienced
review: The ashram is very large and beautiful. Several residential programs on Yoga are conducted as also spiritual retreats. The arati on the ghats of the ashram is a divine experience.

title: Serene environment and calm setting - Peaceful abode
review: I did not stay here in June '18 since it was full. But I visited it. It is  a great setting, the ASHRAM and the Ganga aarti is unique with mesmerizing bhajans - especially the Hanuman Chalisa, on the banks of Gange gives a wonderful experience. Good vegetarian food in the canteen. The Rishi kumars have the food amidst chanting of the shlokas.

title: Love love love
review: The energy and vibe of this place is magical. Really magical. I loved the Ganga Aarti, but also just being in the presence of the swamis and feeling so at peace. Satsungs were always a pleasure. I love it here, wish they had open rooms when I was there so I could stay. If you want to stay here, book in advance.

title: Aarti at the Temple
review: I had the experience to participate on the Aarti cerimony and also offer flowers to Mother Ganges. Loved it all!

title: Spiritual Ambience and graceful ganga aarti
review: The place had very soothing and charged atmosphere. Vibes are very positive and inspiring. Ghats are very elaborate and broad with clean surrounding.

title: Must see
review: Anyone interested in An ashram in Rishikesh needs to stop here. It is an authentically spiritual traditional ashram that is very western friendly – a variety of cleanreasonably priced rooms with showers and western toiletsA clear program of activities, good classes, courteous and professional management

title: Just a normal Lord Ram temple
review: Its just one of those places which you have in your list of places to visit since there are not many places out there to visit  with lots of quotes in sanskrit inscribed on the walls

title: Very beautiful place. Very serne
review: Visited this during stay in Rishikesh from 10/7 to 10/11. ganga Aarthi is perfomed excellent here. We did not stay in the Ashram. The place hums with Yoga, Meditation and spirituality

title: Can’t miss it
review: Famous Ganga Arati and the Shiva Statue sitting on the river platform!

title: The best place for aarti in rishikesh
review: So i have to admit i have not witness anything as such in my life. Such peace and politeness in this place . Everyone just praying . The views were so soooo good and lovely scene to experience. I am short of words and just want to say once in your lifetime everyone should come here .. The aarti is one of a kind ...

title: Amazing evening Aarti
review: Lovely and very serene and spiritual evening Aarti by the River Ganga. A must if you are in Rishikesh.

title: Perfect location for Ganga Aarti
review: This place made me feel religious and connected to God. The entire atmosphere which was created during the aarti just took us to another World.

title: One of the best Ashrams in Rishikesh
review: Located on the Ghats , Parmarth Niketan is one of the best Ashrams in Rishikesh which is known for it's evening Aarti which happens every evening at 6pm. If not Triveni ghat,  you have to be here in the evening in Rishikesh.

title: Arti
review: The arti was awesome. Very inclusive. Not crowded. You can take part in the arti  too

title: Calming!!!
review: Really nice place very calm very neat and clean you will feel yourself in the lap of holy river MAA GANGE

title: Not a big fan!
review: I respect the spiritual journeys undertaken by thousands who come here but I cannot bring myself to feel in any way moved by spirituality. The odd sermons I heard felt more like mindless ravings. I do not recommend staying or visiting. Their evening Aarti is nonsensical as the brass utensil carrying flames are tossed around carelessly. An accident waiting to happen!

title: Evenings
review: If you go in the evenings for the ceremony, be sure to sit further down from the ceremony itself if you have a problem with stray dogs and flies. It's hard to get a great view because most people are filming with their phones, but if you arrive early you can get close.

title: Serene and amazing place
review: We stayed here for two days and had a lovely time here. This place is oh so serene and beautiful. The evening arti makes it even better. Its easily accessible place and has many eateries and ahops just outside the campus.

title: Truly Spiritual Experience
review: The is a must see place and cannot be missed on a Rishikesh visit. The evening Ganga Aarthi is really spiritually uplifting. The Shiva statue in the Ganga river is an awesome sight, and couldn't resist a picture with Lord Shiva in the background.

title: Ganga Aarti at Rishikesh
review: This temple is famous for its Ganga Aarti every evening . The temple is dedicated to Lord Shiva and the Ashram has very good accommodation for stay at a nominal charges .

title: Divine Ganga Aarati
review: Participated in the evening Ganga aarati. Mesmerizing experience to sing under the evening skies with live music.

title: Best for yoga
review: Every morning 6am start yoga classes near river ganga oh my god its a one of the best experiences ever i had

title: Beautiful Asharam
review: This is one of the famous Asharam. This ashram is made in very big area. They also have hotel also. Place is very neat and clean.

title: maintenance problem
review: parmarth niketan is falling into shambles with no maintennace and the entire place dirty and shabby.

title: Place with Ganga arti
review: If you wanna enjoy the Ganga arti, there is the place to do it. Be prepared to take shoes off and if you wanna make a ritual buy some flower box and make your wish come true on Ganga river

title: A very interesting ashram to visit and learn about Indian mythology
review: As mentioned a unique Ashram, beautifully designed with nice gardens and statues of the Indian Lords

title: A must see in rishikesh.
review: Very busy place but definitely worth a visit. Try and get over the bridge well in advance of the ceremony and the Julian laxman bridge gets rammed. There's loads of shops to visit in the market area beforehand. After the ceremony take a nice walk back over the lit bridge at night.

title: Parmarth Niketan Ashram, truly divine place in Rishikesh
review: Parmarth Niketan Ashram  located just beside the Ram Jhula we visited on 16.05.18 along with family and friends. It is really peaceful and homely atmosphere which is  very encouraging the visitors. A big canteen of the ashram is serving quality food to all visitors on a very reasonable rate in comparison to other famous food stalls.

title: Good place to visit with family members
review: The aashram is located on the swarg aashram side of ram jhula , approx 10 mins walking distance from ram jhula , the scenic view of Ganga ji can't be described in words ,one can sit for hours there .

title: Must do when visiting Rishikesh, spiritual or not.
review: This ceremony is on of the symbols of Rishikesh. Not visiting this ceremony is not visiting Rishikesh. It is a everyday ceremony next to the Ganges where all people come together for a ceremony to get godess light. It is a free entrance place which starts everyday around sunset. You can get in/out whenever you want and just listen to the music, songs, and prayers. There are candles and you can offer flowers in the Ganges and make a wish.

title: As serene as ever, everytime
review: We eagerly wait to attend Ganga Aarti at Parmarth Niketan during our annual visit to this area. All of our family loves the way it is conducted, the calmness and serenity of the environment, the Shiva in Dhyan mudra with Sun setting behind.. its always a greatest of experiences.. loved Aarti performance of Sufi musicians of various ethnicity, geography and religions this time.

title: Wonderful Place and AMAZING ARATI
review: The visit to this temple was incredible.  They pay great attention to detail, are authentic, and kind.  The place is quite clean and they even have a prasadam (blessed food)  hall and a guest house!  Their Ganga Puja must be experienced at least once in a lifetime!

title: Great place to dip in the Ganges
review: This area is lovely and easy to safely enter the Ganges river for a dip. Aarti is held here each nite

title: On bank of Ganga!
review: Very nicely located on the bank of Ganga and good condition with clean place too!

title: Simply Divine
review: The high point of every visitor to Rishikesh, is to attend the famous Ganga AArti by the steps of Parmarth Niketan Temple. The spiritually haunting chants, the wild spalsh of colours, the power of the Ganga flowing rapidly and the dusky skyline, all come together and can easily put one in a trance. A definite must visit for everyone travelling to Rishikesh.

title: Beautiful view and location
review: Beautiful place to spend some time with family and little one. One can go to Ghat and sit in silence & enjoy the view. Bholenath statue is amazing and background adds to it. Aarti happens in evening but could not able to take part. One should visit..

title: Ganga arti at its best
review: You can see ganga arti at many places in rishikesh but believe me parmarth niketan has best one,,

title: Parmarth Niketan- A  Yoga Ashram
review: Parmarth niketan -largest ashram in rishikesh with 1000 rooms and basically known for Yoga. Open for all visitors.

title: Worth a Visit.
review: Located besides Ram Jhula, Parmarth Niketan Temple/ghat offers mesmerizing and spiritual evening Aarti. Sitting on the steps of ghat/temple, one can witness and participate in well managed Aarti. One can also take a diya and perform Aarti. Though, there are large clean spaces to sit, reaching early & secure a place is recommended. Apart from other beautiful/colourful idols, the temple has Lord Shiv and Hanuman idols.

title: Best aarti
review: The aarti (sunset ceremony) is amazing. The ashram itself is an oasis, and a must see for anyone in Rishikesh.

title: a second option
review: not much cannot be expected from this place as compared to old days. bit hectic and materialistic with live recording and cameras and guest appearances. the religious feeling cannot be felt moreover it seems privatized ceremony. though the view is good of the ghat and the ashram is nice for a visit .

title: clean and well maintained
review: there are large spaces for devotees to sit, it is clean with drinking water, toilet and dustbin facilities

title: Home away from home at Gateway of Himalayas
review: Rishikesh is the gateway to the Himalayas and from here begins the Char Dham yatra of the Sanatan Followers - in which they cover BAdrinath, Kedarnath , Yamunotri and Gangotri.  PArmarth Ashram provides clean, hygenic and simple accomodation as a avery affordable rate . Evening Aarti is mind blowing and mesmerises. It has satsang hall and residents are expected to attend the morning satsang. Evening there are discourses on various spiritual topics.

title: Most amazing ashram and spiritual center
review: Groups can book stay here cheap during religious months having Bhagwat sessions.On banks of Ganga in cradle of Neelkanth hills.Aamzing lcoaqtion on main chats.

title: Big ashraam
review: Probably the most notable and biggest ashraam in Rishikesh, open for public, and they have Gangga aarti every evening. Sunset behind the Shiva statue is just magnificent.

title: ganga aarti
review: If you do have some time in rishikesh than you can visit this place at evening. There will be a beautiful ganga aarti before/at the time of sunset. You can also take your diya and perform aarti if you are able to reach there early and take your place. or if you just want to see the aarti,i suggest you go on to the bridge beside lord shiva statue,from there you will have good view of aarti and small performance.

title: Ganga Aarti.....
review: This place has an amazing Ganga Aarti every evening. The atmosphere is just awesome and it gives you a Divine Pleasure to be a part of it.The giant Statue to Lord Shiva in the Ganges is another USP of this place. A must visit place in Rishikesh..

title: Aarti
review: Visited for aarti and just amazed to see small kids performing aarti, very beautiful view of ganga and sunset

title: Poorly mannered staff
review: Visited this place for evening aarti with lot of expectations. Though the aarti was very good and well managed, subsequent behaviour by some of the staff was condemanble to say the least. While some of the staff was allowing people to visit Shiva statue in front of the ashram, later some ashram staff started shouting at them in a very bad and threatening tone to move out (why were they allowed in first place). Another staff behaved badly and shouted at people sitting on riverbank at middle podium thrreatening them to move away ( he could have told that to them politely). When i went back to collect shoes (around half n hour after aarti, the guy there behaved badly and told me that i hd held him up from closing the shoe counter. He didnt pacify even when i expressed regret and suggested that they should place a board mentioning timings. My small child rightly questioned me as to how such angry people can teach meditation and yoga to others when they cant control their own anger.

title: Beautiful Shiva Statue
review: Religious place , flocked by locals as well as tourists , very close to Ram Jhula , they perform Ganga Aarthi every evening and have a few smaller temples inside for differ deities

title: beautiful ararti
review: VERY CLEAN GHAT AND EXCELLENT GANGA ARATI !!!

title: Ganga Arti
review: A must do. Can't go to Rishikesh and miss it. The cerimony is fascinating and people is so nice and kind. Without words you feel home

title: Home at Himalaya
review: Beautiful experience. Felt magical. Enjoyed the bhajans which transported me to different world.Great experience of Ganga Aarti. Truly Divine. Felt peaceful and contended.

title: Awesome Parmarth Temple and Ghat
review: Opposite Parmarth NIketan Ashram, its a lovely temple with very clean and beautiful Ghat, which also offers "Ganga Arti" on every evening.

title: Tirtha Yatras
review: Superb Location.Gangaji ki Aartee and Superb sunset view. Superb Gurukul Singing hym of The lord. Super view of ganga .Extremely pious and positive Energy .When aartee finish a small walk to lakhman Jula then back .Nice market very liw price.Many bio Products and health related medication.Nice location for Yoga

title: Really enjoyed the Aarti
review: This place had the felling of the Aarti. All the people were involved in the ceremony. The place was clean and really enjoyed the chanting to God here. Much much better then trevani ghat Aarti . If you have chose between them . Then go to brabhat ghat .

title: Artificial and forced
review: We visited this Ashram expecting it to be a place full of spiritual vibes, but it was not to be. Its possible that the decor of the place put me off. There were too many garishly painted and dis proportionate statues all around, too much stuff written everywhere, too many bright colours ; in short too much overt effort to appear "Dharmic"

title: Spiritual
review: Due to lack of time, we could not visit Ashram in full, only in tit bits. But we loved the spiritual environment. I was simply bowled over by Lord Shiva's meditating statue there. I'm already missing the Ashram. Will come again next time for sure to experience divinity here.

title: Big aashram
review: Walked past this place on one of our jaunts around town. This place host an evening Aarti at the banks of the Ganga river. The surroundings are well maintained and clean. Big statues of lord Shiva and Hanuman seem to be the major draws.

title: Very Spiritual atmosphere - Ganga Aarti
review: Place to be in  during sunset. There is Hanuman Chalisa path followed by some other hymns and Ganga Aarti. Atmosphere is wonderful. Ashram/Temple is right on the banks of river ganga.

title: Nice experience
review: We went to the ashram for watching the evening Ganga aarti. It's better if you go early & secure a place for your family so that you can get to see the aarti properly. The view of river Ganga is pretty mesmerising from the ashram.

title: Beautiful gardens and vibe.
review: A lovely place to visit. The garden is spectacular. The huge statue of Shiva. It is a yoga retreat and ashram. I hope to go next year. It is clean and looks like a comfartable place to stay. Peaceful and reflective on the Ganges. Everyone will find a sense of peace. Recomend going here.

title: Peaceful Place.!!!!
review: Its a must go place, where you can sit by the Ganges, see the Ganga Aarti, explore the market around.

title: Temple
review: Parmarth niketan temple is situated at the bank of river Ganga. One can go through Ram Jhula to reach there. They have maintained ghat, canteen and temple very well.

title: Serene Place
review: An evening visit to Parmarth Niketan Temple by Ganga can be utilised for witnessing the pious Ganga Aarti. This should be followed by the river side walk and shopping there.

title: Yoga Centre in foothills of Himalayas
review: It is a very pleasant feeling when you visit this complex.

title: Peaceful and homely atmosphere
review: Visited Parmarth Niketan Ashram on 19.4.2018 along with family.  The peaceful and homely atmosphere of the Ashram is very encouraging the visitors.  Moreover canteen  of the ashram is serving quality food to all visitors on a very reasonable rate in comparison to other famous food joints of the area

title: Serene Place
review: one cant fathom the place on a small visit. ideally one must stay here and take part in all their activities to truly understand the path of Yoga, Sadhna and Moksha.

title: A Holly Place for peace of Soul and Mind
review: If you are in Rishikesh then must visit Parmarth Niketan once, it is a place which will gives you everything you want in a holly place, Parmarth Niketan name is world famous and dosen't required any review as people from Arts, Politics, World leaders has visit there and admire it most. Must visit once and dont forget to have dinner/ lunch or breakfast in canteen.

title: Arti is special
review: Love the arti along the water each evening. Its a special gathering around the fire and fun chant, meditate and connect with the community all together.

title: Ganga Aarti
review: My first time in rishikesh....was told this will be a beautiful experience. Loads of people attending and devotees singing and praying. The Aarti is nice but it's really crowded so it's not easy to get Darshan, etc

title: Wonderful aarthi ceremony
review: Unlike those in Haridwar and Varanasi, the aarthi ceremony here involves the audience and it's possible for even foreign visitors to participate.

title: The largest Ashram in Rishikesh with 1000 rooms
review: We have to cross over the Ram Jhula Bridge, and walk towards the right side road, and after passing several shops along the Ganga river bank, we will reach this great Parmarth Niketan Ashram. It is said to contain 1000 rooms with modern facilities for the pilgrims. The Ashram  is well defined with beautiful gardens all over, colourful buildings with divine images all over. The activities of Ashram includes daily universal prayers in the morning, yoga and meditation classes and daily Satsang and lecture programs. Kirtan, the famous Ganga Aarthi is conducted  at sun set.

title: Most amazing experience of my life!!
review: The Ganga aarti at Parmarth Niketan is a life changing experience! It's a must do for anyone visiting the area!

title: Retreat experience
review: Everything perfect ---beautiful grounds, food excellent ---the one exception to our satisfaction was the cleanliness of the toilets

title: Enjoyed
review: Visit parmarth for ganga aarti. Place fullfill with crowed . Aarti was so lovely by small small pandit group .enjoyed

title: Nothing special
review: There is not anything special to see except a shiva meditative statue built on a platform in Ganga river , just adjacent to ghat. There are some other statues of hindu gods also. Nothing which might excite a Indian hindu who has seen these statues as idols daily in temples.

title: Unexpected Jewel in the Crown
review: My hotel address for RIshikesh said (Behind Paramath Niketan.) Its difficult after winding roads through hillside to get the bearings but a day later realized the Paramath Niketan is an ashram (lodgings and halls surrounding an open plan temple of Gods leading to the Ganges and from which aarti ghat occurs every night. In Rishikesh you cannot mis it but I would describe the design as classical Hindu design as heaven on earth where the Go0ds reside amongst our ordinary lives.

title: Great experience
review: Must to the Ganga Aarti every evening at around 6pm approx... The Ashram premises and beautiful gardens and its is very peaceful to sit by the Ganges and listen to the prayers.. Watch the ceremony

title: Peace
review: Peaceful , amazing Aarti in the evening, best part is small kids reciting Ganga Arti with enthusiasm. But what I don’t like is they give preference to foreigners and not Indians . I think this is everywhere in India

title: POSITIVE AND PEACE AURA ALL AROUND
review: Before visiting the Parmarth Niketan Ashram, I went through all the "not so good" reviews on the internet from as much sites as possible. Believe me, I was extra cautious, but my experience turned out to be too good.

title: A beautiful Oasis
review: This place has a really good vibe and spirit, I love it to walk through. Everything is supercline and enjoyable - just wonderful!

title: Visited for Ganga Aarti
review: This temple is located on the other side of Ram Jhula and has a narrow crowed approach lane. You can visit here for Ganga Aarti starting at 5:30 pm. They give the "diyas" to general public and involve everything in the Aarti which is a great experience.

title: Ganga arti nice
review: Good to see ganga arti.  Very religious place. Must see in riskiesh. Spirituality,  May vary game darshab

title: Beautiful Ganga Aarti
review: One of the best places in Rishikesh if you wish to participate in the ceremony of Ganga Aarti. Great atmosphere!

title: Very near to ram jhula.
review: Must visit temple and do join the evening aarti and enjoy the sun set while sitting along the bank of ganges

title: VISIT FOR THE 6 PM GANGA ARTHI- VERY VERY SPECIAL
review: This long time ashram is the best in Rishikesh. They offer housing and food for spiritual seekers. Each evening is the Ganga Artthi, where the preceding Swami Chidanand

title: the nicest temple in the area.
review: This is the main temple and Ghat where the ceremonies happen. there are also some nice statues and a nice little garden for resting . Now remember you are in India, which is to be honest a very noisy place, where you could be participating in a ceremony by the Ganges, and the road workers a few meters away are doing massive works with a lot of noise...so keep smiling :)

title: Very peaceful
review: This ashram has a very different aura.... U feel positive about it...Ganga Arti is mesmerising.... Booking need to be done in advance

title: Nice
review: Good to visit with family as very religious and peaceful place. Old architecture of temple is really attraction.

title: Hai its amazing @
review: It's really amazing place to visit whenever u go to Rishikesh ,to visiting Parmath Nik. Its a Reality to our life .

title: Serene place with clam and positive vibes in the air
review: I went there on 31 Dec for Aarti and satsang. The feel and positive vibes of the place was a true bliss. Q&A session was short on that day but probably what ever was asked by others was what I wanted to know. I was lucky to be blessed by guruji himself when I touched his feet after satsang. I felt a calm in me. I also saw Gopichand that badminton legend that day. I was also lucky to see Mr Anil kapoor the next day during Aarti.  Leaving apart this the vibes in the air at Aashram is what I call “True Bliss”.

title: Bussiness
review: El que conoce India sabe que éste es el Arti Puja más comercial que jamás hayan visto. The one who knows India knows that this is the most commercial Arti Puja they have ever seen

title: Very beautiful temple!
review: This is a large temple with beautiful statues and decorations. Very peaceful place! Their aarti in the evening at the ghat is also worth attending!

title: The Aarti is a must-attend
review: The temple didn't appeal to me but do attend the arti conducted by them in the evening. It's a special experience..

title: Could not see the aarti
review: A friend recommended this as the best aarti and we were very disappointed.  Could not see the arti even though we got their early, found good seats and waited an hour.  Do not recommend.

title: The best ashram in the world
review: Loved the Ganga Aarti and this is such a phenomenally popular world famous ashram and cultural association, the gardens are sublime and staying here is a must. And you must book at least 6 months in advance.

title: Beautiful and harmonious
review: We were lucky to stumble onto this gem as we were walking passed. It happened to be exactly at 5:15 pm when their ceremony begins. Having been to Varanasi at every ceremony their is an expectation to constantly buy things or pay for prayers, that is definitely not the case here. There is no pressure, in fact there is just nothing to pay for. After the beautiful chanting they start to hand out little plates with fire on them for you to do your prayers. Again, no paying or expectation to pay. There is a place to keep your shoes and the art work is pretty spectacular.

title: Amazing ceremony
review: Amazing experience seeing the experience and being part of the ceremony. Worth the drive from where ever you are staying,

title: Historic Temple of Rama
review: This temple belongs to God Ram.  This is very ancient temple near the Ganga River.  Its situated near Ram Jhula.  Very nice temple and one must visit here

title: Worth visiting
review: Very beautiful! With many beautiful statues of different gods and goddesses.

title: long and narrow bridge over Ganga
review: This old bridge which nearly a century old is long and quite narrow... one feels little worried when walking the bridge even though it is very safe.

title: Good place to see
review: located at bank of ganga. the ashram has lot of gods inside and its big enough. You can see lot of foreigners came for yoga training. There are lot of options to shop and eat.

title: No clarity...lot of gimmick
review: Went for spiritual discourse. Disappointed with the kind of interaction, more fancy environment, less Peace. Answer to questions were not up to satisfaction.

title: Parmath Niketan
review: This place allows to stay only if you are attending the jagran over there, they are very strict with rules

title: Temples within temple
review: I did not explore the whole ashram. The ashram is big and with beautiful clay sculptures of God and Goddesses. There are many temples inside the premises. I visited only the main one.

title: i have not stayed so please ignore this review if you are considering it for staying...
review: parmarth is a big name and i never expected sch poor maintenance of their bathroom, the urinals, and the basin taps were all overflowing, and so dirty....even the canten basin is so dirty, and the food quality is also below the mark....

title: spiritual place and famous
review: you can see a lot of foreigners staying around the campus of ashram. place has divinity in it due to its proximity to River ganga and the famous aarti in the evening. the chants and the bells make the place holy to think about and experience.

title: Pleasant temple!!!
review: The parmath niketan temple is a good and superb temple in this place. Divine experience. We went to this temple early morning.

title: if in rishikesh...this is a must
review: 31 december.. and you are here! nothing can be bigger peace than watching the aarti live and swamiji adressing the crowd. yes, it is a must irresepctive of where you come from, what you do and what ethnicity you come from. it is a wonderland.

title: Parmarth temple
review: Temples worth visiting . Blessed to be there for aarti . serene feeling on  banks of ganga . Every minute spent is worth .

title: wonder filled evening Gangaji Arti
review: Certainly worth crossing the Ram Jula to the east side of Gangaji for evening Arti & kirtan. This is a large well-known & well organized Ashram.

title: large place with nice lawns
review: Many people go there for the lunch which is tasty and not too spicy.

title: Interesting
review: Can be added to Rishikesh itinerary for some quiet time and insight into a typical ashram. The place is huge, well maintained and open to public.

title: Aarti At Parmarth Ni Ketan is a Unique One
review: Parmarth Niketan is built by  Pujya Swami Shukdevanandji Maharaj in 1942 which is before the Independence of India But even after 75 years This Ashram is very Fresh and Positive..

title: Meet the God
review: A place to be remembered for long,to reach you have to take a boat ride and once there you are greeted with essence of freshness and purity of air.God blessed city and ashram a abode of feeling peace.Try the yoga shivir

title: Peaceful
review: Very Peaceful Place and huge ashram. Ganga Arti is good here but look more scripted version just look like they are performing for movie. Overall good place to visit or stay.

title: Interesting temple and ashram with bathing ghats on the Ganges
review: Take a peek around this quintessentially Indian temple, ashram and ghat complex. Hindu statuary abounds amid well-tended gardens. Staff don't mind if you look around and peek into the nice cafeteria and even sit down for satsang with the resident swami. Note the differences between the Indian ashram, which is set up for comfort and enlightenment, and the Western versions which stress deprivation, discomfort and cruddy food. Yes, you can enjoy yourself and be spiritual! Take a dip in the Ganges from the ashram's spectacular ghats and release your own flower garland or floating candle offering.

title: Calm and peaceful ashram
review: Once you enter the ashram, it is very peaceful here. Good arrangements for stay and food for the pilgrims. Evenings are special with the aarti of Gangaji being performed in very disciplined manner. One is left spell bound by the spiritual uplift ment in the cool breeze near the ganga ghat at the time of aarti

title: very large place
review: this temple near ram jhula. it is very big pace with lawns. if you want to peace visit here in morning. you will feel good. a must visit place if you have time

title: attended the arti
review: It was enchanting experience , I travelled with my entire family my parents also . We loved the walk to the Parmath Aashram . Eateries are wonderful with all kind of food available roadside .

title: Should experience Ganga Arti
review: I like this place more than other Ashrams here. You can sit back near Ganga and it has a strong spiritual experience. You should attend Ganga Arti its very stress relieving. Hope you enjoy.. :)

title: Visit Parmath Niketan
review: Must visit Parmath Niketan Temple when you visit Rishikesh in Uttarakhand, India. Also make it to point to visit it's well stocked Ayurvedic medicine outlet.

title: good ashram
review: we visit there to attend ganga aarti. there was not much crowd. you can enjoy aarti. please visit here if you are in rishikesh

title: Ganga Aarti
review: Rishikesh is a country of sages, saints and pilgrims. It's wonderful to be here. Strong positive energy is felt. It is no surprise that pilgrims come here from all over the world. Parmarth Niketan Ashram is located next to the holy Ganges River and at the foot of the Himalayas. The beautiful ashram is well maintained and clean! Most important for me is that this ashram is open for all, that there is no discrimination against race, gender, nationality, religion and caste. Many travelers visit this ashram for Ayurvedic treatments, which includes exercises, music therapy, meditation, pranayama and yoga meditation. It is also possible to practice reiki and other ancient Indian sciences.

title: Spirituality
review: Existence of both spirituality and godliness . Unique blend of peace and happiness. The evening bhajans near the ganges along with aarti and teachings by Guruji will take you to a different world . Ganga here is full of energy but still it surrounds you with calm and peace.. the cool water erases all the worry and stress. .

title: best ashram in rishikesh
review: I will recommended parmarth niketan who visit rishikesh. Its a spiritual place and yoga school as well as

title: View from temple
review: Spectacular views of the Ganges. Very beautiful temple with many levels and many vignettes of the gods and goddesses of India. Wonderful energy here

title: Holidays
review: This place is awesome. One must visit this place.  We have attended Ganga Aarti here really good. we had our dinner inside Ashram, food is simple but delicious.

title: Beautifully set ashram in the banks of ganga
review: Paramarth niketan, a well set and a disciplined ashram in the banks of river ganga. Be there for the homa and the ganga arati at night. it is very pious sight...

title: A very Nice and Serene place along Maa Gange (Holy River)
review: The Place is an Ashram and not a Hotel. River Ganges is just Opposite and one can sit along the Ghat for hours . Ganga Arti (5:30 PM - 7 PM) is done by the Ashram itself which should be attended daily in the evening.

title: A Must Visit in Rishikesh
review: It is situated adjacent to Gita Bhawan in Swargashram area near Ram Jhula. Spread over a vast area, it contains many temples inside the Ashram. It also runs a canteen where tasty foods - from tea to breakfast to lunch/dinner is available at reasonable rates. The timing for breakfast/lunch/dinner is strictly followed. The best part of Parmarth Niketan is its Ganga Aarti which starts around 6 pm and runs for nearly an hour. Babaji Sh. Chidanand Saraswati who heads Parmarth Niketan is a big name in the fraternity.

title: Very Good
review: I have been there several times. The aarti is outstanding, and always done with class, stye and dignity

title: Enchanting, peaceful and a must experience
review: We friends from Bangalore witnessed the Arathi on the banks of the Ganges at the Paramarth Niketan Ashram, on 29th July 2017. The experience was out of the world, mesmerising and the Keerthan was the best of the evening. We sat through the entire evening of Bhajans, Hanuman Chalisa and took part in the Arathi, all of us getting a chance to hold on to the Arathi. It was magical, so serene, peaceful and something to cherish always. A special mention to the Keerthan singers who just took the feel and vibe to a different level and world all together. Kudos and I wish to go there again.

title: The place for Ganga Aarathi
review: The Parmarth Niketan is the place for performing the Ganga Aarathi in Rishikesh. It is located on the opposite bank of Triveni Ghaat in Rishikesh. The Gita Bhavan is in the neighbourhood. It has to be accessed by crossing the Ram jhula. And the through the Shivanand Ashram.

title: Not so impressive Ganga arati
review: Having read great reviews on the evening Ganga arati at Parmarth, we made it a point to witness it during our recent visit. However, we were disappointed.

title: Go only if you have interest in visiting the Ashrams
review: There are many ashrams in Rishikesh near Ram Jhula. Parmarth ashram is one of them. The place is neat and clean. If you are interesting in visiting the Ashrams then only you should go here. Kids will not enjoy here.

title: Beautiful place with mystical looks
review: Look from left to right.... breath in.... Now, right to left..... breath out. The Ganges, the iron bridge, the beautiful temples and things happening around will leave you spellbound.

title: Negative vibes
review: This places has an uncanny resemblance and negative vibe of the current pseudo Godmen phenomenon thats doing the rounds on media these days. The baba ji here seems to be more interested in making money than giving a pure non commercial spiritual experience. Highly avoidable.

title: Ganga Aarti
review: I was there to see the Ganga Aarti ceremony next to the river. Lovely singers and nice people. The ashram looks from outside well maintained and clean!

title: Stroll around the Niketan
review: Take your time and stroll around the grounds of this wonderful temple/ashram in the daytime then experience Aarti in the evening

title: The HOLY experince .. !!!
review: We visited this place during evening for GANGA aarti, the place has good vibes but too much of unregulated crowd during aarti so we could not enjoy it fully, still a worth palce to visit during GANGA AARTI

title: Beside Ram Jhula
review: Parmath Niketan Temple is on one side of Ram Jhula. I visited this temple for evening Ganga Aarti. The atmosphere of this temple was very relaxing.

title: Enjoy Evening Aarti
review: One word - DIVINE. Sooths your soul when you hear the aarti and vedic rhymes in the evening. MEsmerizing view. Ensure to reach there and occupy seat before the aarti begins.

title: Ganga Aarti was very nice at this place.
review: Had a great time being there it was a very nice experience to see Ganga Aarti live happening with soulful bhajans and that too on Ganga shore.

title: Divine Ganga Arti - must experience!
review: This was my first visit to Rishikesh - spent evening by the Holy Ganga river at Parmath Niketan Temple - amazing view of setting sun amidst clouds, light breeze with beautiful melody of flowing water. For once, you feel you are in a different planet altogether!

title: Must visit !
review: We were lucky enough to visit Parmarth Ghat and be blessed by the Aarti at Parmath Ghat , Ram Jhula. Rishikesh trip would have been incomplete without it. One may even check out for Geeta Press, Gorakhpur, store,  5 min. walk from Parmarth Ghat .

title: Meditative Living
review: This was my first time in the Himalayas and its was the perfect experience for basic, meditative living.

title: for visiting the ghats
review: This is one place where you can go for your getting spiritually rejuvenate. You can also come to this place to visit Ganga river.

title: Vadic Place as well as beautiful temple
review: Very nice and beautiful ashram. Evening Ganges aarthi by small children and vedic chanting is really a site to watch. One of the decent gates to take bath in Ganges with cloth changing facilities. Neatly maintained. But located in narrow lanes but good maintained cleaning at the place, worth visit the place.

title: Too Commercialized
review: The last time I went to this place about an year ago, I had the best experience of Ganga Aarti. However, when I went this time, the whole experience was different. They had it too much commercialized with Orchestra, live performances and video cameras, similar to what is there in Haridwar.

title: Experience the divine Ganga Aarti here
review: The ambience at Parmaarth Niketan is divine. The Ganga Aarti held daily before sunset is a divine experience quite different from noisy ones elsewhere. Don't miss it if you are at Rishikesh/ Haridwar.

title: Best Place at the of Sun set  to view the Ganga Aarti
review: Pujya Swami Chidanand Saraswati is the president and spiritual head of the Parmarth Niketan Ashram, a spiritual institution based in Rishikesh, India. He is also the founder and spiritual head of the Hindu Jain Temple in Pittsburgh.

title: Great Place
review: Great place to visit where Ganga Aarti is performed daily. Well maintained with nice garden. Aarti was worth attending

title: One of the good temples around Ganga.
review: One must visit 3-4 hours before the evening aarti to visit such temples around the ghat. Can go through the books avalaible if you have an inclination towards indian culture and heritage,

title: holy, quaint n enjoyable
review: those read this and planning to visit ahead... there is ample of space to settle down before the arti so dont rush and do not push n pull... .it could be dangerous for those by the banks N they may simply fall... The rapids are strong here too.

title: A spiritual home
review: Parmarth stay was very nice for us especially ganga aarti. We had one of the great evenings of our life at the bank of holy ganga.

title: Best yoga and evening aarti in the town
review: During my 1 month visit to rishikesh I used to go there everyday for evening yoga class followed by evening aarti. The experience can not be expressed in words. Must try 3 Am yoga class(donation basis) and evening aarti just before sunset. Those floating diya's will steal your heart.

title: Ganga ceremony
review: It's a great place to relax and enjoy nature .A place to gain your peace of mind. Me and my friend very lucky that we visited this place everything about this is best. Specially the ganga ceremony they do in the evening. It's really worth visiting

title: Must attend Ganga Aarti
review: Ganga Aarti@Parmarth Niketan is so involving and spiritually fulfilling.

title: Bring a bag for your own shoes to avoid the rush
review: This worth checking out - thought there seem to be more tourists than people there to worship. Good atmosphere, good music. unlimited people taking selfies.

title: Ganga aarti, phenomenal
review: This was my third visit to this wonderful temple. We participated in the aarti which very inspirational and calming. A wonderful mix of nationalities present. Get there early for better seating.

title: Beautiful
review: It's a great place in Rishikesh. Clean and well maintained. Many little temples and exhibition of Vedic stories inside this. Big park and Cafe also.

title: Beauitiful temple
review: I attended aarti at Parmarth Niketan Bhavan & was a very good experience. I became completely spiritual. Highly recommended to all.

title: Amazing experience
review: Wonderful to see the Ganga arti performed. Not very crowded and we got to see the entire event from a close distance.

title: THE place for Arti in Rishikesh
review: Every evening you can enjoy the Arti ceremony among many others pilgrims.

title: Always a pleasure
review: Breezy, cosy, spiritual. A bit crowded and always a smattering of foreign devotees. The place is well managed with shoe racks, drinking water, aarti being passed around.

title: where is Chidanand Muni
review: I was searching chidanand muni here. I saw him before 4 years and he said me that he will be here. But here he was not. I am big fan of Chidu.

title: great place to see the sunset fire ceremony, historic and very authentic
review: i played music here, meditated, plunged in the Ganga river and watched the fire ceremony each afternoon for 8 weeks on my trip to india.

title: Always crowded, but worth an experience.
review: the temple situated on the banks of the ganges, always has crowds coming in from all over the world.

title: Peaceful, Spiritual, Spectacular
review: Introduction: Along the banks of the Ganges and in the lap of lush green Himalayas, this temple is one of the major landmarks of Rishikesh. The temple is situated next to the ashram and is 1100 acres big, spread all across the place. The main location is the Ghat where people gather to attend the evening aart. I would recommend this place if you are planning for an overnight stay as the place gets peaceful, with clean atmosphere, cool breeze and the evening view s spectacular.

title: Beautiful Ashram Ganga Aarti must watch
review: It's a beautiful Ashram, located just near to ganga banks. Evening Aarti is a must to attend. What a beautiful scenario that is. What a peace sitting at Ganga banks. Just enjoy.

title: Beautiful Facility on the Ganges
review: Beautiful ashram on the ganges right by the Ram Jhoula walking bridge. Be sure to check out the aarti performed daily at 6pm, very moving.

title: Divine
review: This place is something else. It is amazing to see people of different culture take in the rich Hindi culture. The arthi service is something to look forward to. It's  a magnet. You just keep wanting to go back

title: good place to visit
review: i was here with my partner during the yoga course at sattya yoga rishikesh....Parmath Niketan Temple was in my bucket list and i did it...lovely place lovely people and many experience have been share over here...

title: ancient place
review: the place on the other side of ganges in Rishikesh is divine and worth a visit. though a bit crowded overall it is a nice experience

title: A serene place
review: After crossing Lakshman Jhula we came by shared taxi to Ram Jhula and Parmarth Niketan is nearer from there. This is the place where Ganga Aarti is held at Hrishikesh. A good place to have Holy Deep.

title: Yoga and concerts
review: I had a wonderful experience during the music festival mid-March this year! So much beauty and so many truly magical moments gifted by the Goddess!

title: Well maintained and beautiful temple
review: Had a guided tour of the temple and the guide was a resident of the temple. He is not at all greedy and showed the various trees like Rudrakh tree, kalptaru vriksh, and other parts really well.

title: ganga aarti
review: in my opinion if anyone want to see ganga aarti this is right place for that person well maintained ghat.

title: A great evening with ganga aarti
review: Situated new ram jhula, visit for evening ganga aarti if you are in rishikesh. The shiv shambo song playing in near by streets is so mesmerizing that you won't like to come back from that area. Just go in evening and forget everything ,you will feel positive after coming back.

title: Peaceful
review: I liked the peacefulness and tranquility of this place. I loved sitting by the river and the view from the ashram. Must visit if you are in Rishikesh.

title: The Arti is Too commercial
review: The arti on the banks of the ganges is just too commercial. Despite the opportunity to be so serene - theres just no calmnes. the priests are kept busy by tourists and pilgrims who keep giving them cellphones to take photographs.

title: Peace Love and Joy Et Al
review: On advice from our driver, we crossed the Ganges by ferry boat, to attend the evening Aarti here at  Parmarth Niketan Rishikesh

title: Devine experience
review: we attended Holi Aarti at the Parmath Ashram and had a different experience of our lives... the Guruji himself does Ganga ji ki aarti and his melodious voice along with the beautiful music takes you to another world.

title: Aarti!!!
review: Took the opportunity to participate in an Aarti ceremony one evening during my stay in rishikesh. This Temple . was beautiful, convenient, but may be a little crowded but that's to be expected. I enjoyed the service the location, and the overall experience

title: Serene place along the Ganga!
review: Visit Parmath before the aarti and enjoy the quiet, peaceful and serene environment as you watch the Ganga. The place gets a bit crazy around the aarti time so you may consider skipping that if you want to continue being in a tranquil space.

title: Great atmosphere with wonderful staff and volunteers
review: I spent a few days here with my family including my parents.  We were very well looked after and staff went out of their way to help us out.  My niece fell poorly in the middle of the night and the on site doctor was at hand straight away.  They really looked after her.  The facilities are great and right on the banks of River Ganga.  Very peaceful and tranquil and great prashad served.  The icing on the cake is the great Ganga yagna and aarti at sunset.

title: Big ashram
review: Big ashram full of activities . Nice arti happening here every evening during sunset . Come and see! :)

title: Meet your spiritual being here.
review: Serene and spiritual on the banks of holy river Ganges.

title: A nice temple with serene views of Ganges
review: The place has aartis in the morning and evening and its a great time to be there. The tourists are plentiful and if you are staying in rishikesh than you have to cross the Ram Jhoola( suspended bridge, either walking OR by two wheeler.

title: Best evening aarti ceremony in India
review: This is the real deal.  If you want the genuine, true, aarti experience come to Parmath's sunset Aarti.  The setting is perfect sitting on the Ganga river at sunset.  The energy is contagious, joyous and wonderful.  The students and priests present a beautiful and authentic experience that touches everyone who attends.  Wonderful to share this spiritual experience with the students and teachers, locals from Rishikesh as well as tourists.

title: Fantastic
review: The ashram is located on the bankd of the Ganges. It's peaceful and serene atmosphere definitely relaxed you. The evening ganga aarti is definitely not to missed. Try to sit as close as possible in order to feel the vibrations. A place not to be missed .

title: Aarti ceremony astonishing
review: Don't miss the sunset aarti ceremony-- it is powerful and stunningly beautiful. The closer you can get to the central fire areas, the better,  People come from all over and the energy and chanting are otherworldly.

title: Superb Ashram
review: The Ashram is very vast  , has wonderful garden , has  dry good temples / meditation balls inside , has excellent view and access to Ganga river . Really enjoyed my visit . Do not miss it when in Rishikesh

title: Lovely Evening Aarti
review: I found the Ashram to be a kind of "Yoga Disneyland" with all the statues of Gods throughout the premise and just a certain cliche feeling around the spirituality of the place. That being said, it seems like a good place for general knowledge and information based Satsang meetings. The Swami did give good information in response to people's questions. I found it a bit intellectual, but I guess it depends what you're used to.

title: Felt good
review: The Aarti was very different from what it was at har  ki paudi...very peaceful.

title: Parmath Niketan Temple – The biggest ashram and famous yoga centre in Rishikesh
review: Parmath Niketan is a world-famous ashram situated on the bank of holy river Ganga in Rishikesh. It is one of the top yoga centres in India. Peoples from different places of the world, come here for Ayurvedic treatments and yoga The ashram is famous for its Havan and Ganga Aarti that takes place daily in the morning and evening.

title: Best Place for meditation
review: Best Place for meditation, Once you reached to Parmarth Niketan , you feel very confident and cool, In the evning time you can visit Ganga ghat

title: Wonderful Aarti Experience
review: I would recommend all tourists to experience the evening Aarti that takes place in Parmarth Niketan. People from all over the world come here to enjoy the aarti. Words cannot describe the beauty of this Aarti. One needs to be here to experience the same

title: Ganga Aarti
review: I liked Ganga aarti which is performed every evening. Live music and sound created by Ganga makes it very divine experience. Must visit to experience attraction.

title: Divine Aarti and Lovely Sunset Ceremonies at this Eco Conscious Ashram
review: We began our stay in Rishikesh with sunset aarti on the banks of the Ganga at Parmarth Niketan Ashram and it set the beautiful tone for our stay. We stayed in Tapovan by Lakshman Juhla and on the way we noticed how much service the Ashram does to clean up and care for Rishikesh by the many programs they sponsor. We were also thrilled to see that the were sponsoring a concert during our stay by Kirtan/Bhajan singer Jai Uttal. We extended our stay just so we could go to the concert and it was amazing. Beautiful Murtis, Bhajans and Havan on the Ganga. Thank you!

title: Ganga Aarti
review: The ashram is quite and nice place to meditate. But not as lively as Har ki Pauri in haridwar or Triveni Ghat in rishikesh.

title: Beautiful Arti Ceremony
review: We went through the temple which was ok but it was the evening Arti ceremony that starts around sunset that is very lovely and work going to see.  Last just under an hour.

title: VERY CLEAN
review: Ashram is situated in a very nice calm place and its very clean throughout, the Aarti in the evening is a must attend for everyone.

title: Enjoyable Ceremony
review: This seems to be the place that tourist's are told to come see. While it's a nice place with an enjoyable evening ceremony, it does get crowded. I did notice other evening ceremonies along the riverside and went to some of them, which also were just as interesting, but alot less crowded, giving more opportunities to see and get photo's and blessings. I'm not saying don't come and see this but be aware there is other ceremonies around.

title: Good ashram, but too noisy
review: The ashram is good, though I really, really dislike the loudspeakers. The arti can be heard from a long ways away, which is something I hate. I lived across the river more than 1/2 km as a crow flies, and even with all the windows shut, it was still way too loud. I love arti, but not when it's a performance that is inflicted on everyone in the neighborhood. I stayed there overnight once and had to leave because they also have loudspeakers inside the ashram with one thing or another blaring away during the day.

title: Lots of tradition, yoga, and culture
review: Had a really interesting time coming here. Beautiful to walk through, although I didn't get the chance to participate in any of activities when I was here.

title: Inner peace
review: This is one of the peaceful place i have ever visited.  you can spend hours sitting here and the Ganga aarti is just awesome.

title: Most peaceful and serene place in Rishikesh!
review: Just sit at the Ganga ghat at Parmarth Niketan Ashram and you will be in peace. I had planned to spend few minutes but I ended up sitting there in peace for hours mesmerised by the spiritual vibe of the place.

title: Must visit for Ganga Aarti
review: One of the Must Visit places in Rishikesh. We crossed over from Lakshman Jhula, then strolled on the banks of river Ganga towards the Ram Jhula, and reached the Parmarth Niketan temple. As the evening grew towards night, the place was thronged by devotees... Local, Indians as well as foreign nationals. The highlight of the evening was the Ganga Aarti, such an enchanting and mesmerizing experience, the energy and enthusiasm is infectious puts you into a Trance..What a way to end the evening. Must visit and attend the evening Ganga Aarti.

title: Ganga Aarti at Parmarth Niketan Ghat
review: By sitting in the lap of Gangaji in sunset time at parmarth nikentan ghat and aarti and hamuman chalisa is recited by Swami ji takes you in trance and one feel very serene and calm.

title: Serene Location and  must visit
review: Parmarth Niketan is located near the Ram Jhula and very much easily accessible. The ashram has a different aura when you enter, thought its a bit crowded in case there are any sessions in place. You may spend the entire day inside the ashram and would surely find a peaceful place to sit and relax and unwind. The Ganga arti is very nice at the ghat near the ashram. The bhajans and the singing completely moves you when you sit at the ghat and watch the evening arti. A place one should must visit on their trip to Rishikesh.

title: Amazing!
review: The aarti here is sure even better than the most popular Triveni Ghat one (personal opinion)! The place is divine, however, the approach to it may be troublesome for elderly.

title: Beautiful place to visit
review: This ashram is located on the bank of sacred river ganga. One of the largest ashram in rishikesh wherein many people visits daily to this ashram for the evening ganga aarthi.

title: Good Arti
review: The arti here is good. We enjoyed shopping in the area and also food at chotiwala restauant. Nice hangout.

title: Just Superb
review: Parmath Niketan Temple  is most divine &  attractive place in Rishikesh.Parmath Niketan arti is must visit place in Evening

title: Beautiful Ganga Aarti
review: The Ganga Aarti at this place is better than Haridwar. The place is less crowded and the Aarti is carried out for a longer duration.

title: Tranquil
review: What a large Ashram with much to see.  There are many statues of Hindu Gods in the gardens.  The owner promotes clean water.  He also cares for orphans that he finds and they live in the Ashram.  The exit of the Ashram takes to a jewelry shop which is on the way to the Aarti for the evening.

title: The place of evening Aarti at Rishikesh
review: The evening Aarti at Rishikesh takes place in Parmarth Niketan. After all those adventurous activities one can come here and relax. It's less crowded than Haridwar so the experience here is more divine.

title: Yoga and discourse
review: This ashram is way too big..number of activities going on and u may attend as per ur liking. Canteen fr food is open otherwise Jst outside the ashram many food joints r lined up. Attended yoga and discourse..what an amazing experience, it has touched my life and m thirsty fr more. Don't miss to enjoy the feel of Ganges. And the arti during evening at 6 is good experience too. Rishikesh has touched me and m sure something has changed..forever.

title: VERY GOOD
review: Very good to see. You can arrange destination marriage here also due to very near to Ganga ji. Spacious rooms to stay here with all modern facelities.

title: For Evening Ganga Aarti
review: Parmarth Ashram is a beatuful Ashram built on the bank of Ganga near Ram Jhula, It's famous for a beautiful architechture. Visit here for evening Ganga Arti. Best thing is to reach by 5pm so that you get fornt seat and view all the rituals. Also one can have great Vegetarian bood at Parmarth Ashram Canteen situated inside ashram.

title: Best place for Yoga course and stay
review: I had enrolled for 11 days beginners yoga course at Parmarth Niketan, which include stay, food and course.

title: Parmath Niketan/Ashram Temple
review: Location : Walking Distance from Ram Jhula

title: Beautiful
review: The Laxmi Narain temple is really so peaceful when you enter Parmarth temple. There are many other attractions which includes statues of other Hindu dieties. Evening aarti is performed on the Ganga ghat by the trust run by Parmarth temple which is a must attend.

title: Excellent Temple and Ashram
review: If you are not staying there, go in the evening to combine Ashram / Temple visit and Ganga Aarti. Ganga Aarti attracts good crowd and is an amazing feeling.

title: Fantastic Ganga Aarti
review: We always visit Parmarth when coming to Rishikesh, especially for thier awesome Ganga Aarti. And this time around, it was absolutely beautiful and inspiring. The young monks do a great job of organizing, singing and performing the rituals. Mataji's voice is angelic and we always love it when Pujiya Swamiji sings bhajans. You will feel energized and inspired at the Aarti so do not miss it!

title: Attend the Evening Ganga Arti
review: In Rishikesh, Ganga Arti takes place at every ghat but the experience of parmarth niketan is very different from other ghats. Do experience the evening ganga aarti. And enjoy the discourses as well.

title: Out worldly experience
review: Attended the evening arti along the banks of ganga at parmarth niketan. it was a surreal and divine experience as the arti was beautifully done by all the yogis. The ashram itself is well done with over 1000 rooms for people to stay.

title: A religious place to visit with family
review: Awesome feeling whenever i visit this place. The evening Ganga aarti add extol to this place. Nice compound with bhajans and economic canteen make a must visit place.

title: A best place to meditate, during sunset
review: A rare experience, in front of the river Ganges, in the evening. Without any caste & creed / Indian or foreigner/ discrimination, everybody will be worshipping. Best place to spend in the evening in Rishikesh

title: Ganga Aaarti  Sthal Near Urban Sip Cafe
review: Parmarth Niketan is bery near to Urban Sip Cafe from where you can have a cup of coffee after Ganga Aarti. Its a nice place to be there.

title: lovely aarti, great place
review: we witnessed the Dussehra aarti there - really a heart-stirring experience with a great kirtan. the building itself is very nice, and the walk to reach it is uplifting - quiet, green, spiritual - something you'll miss in the noisier parts of India.

title: nice aarti
review: just witnessed the aarti in the evening which starts at 6.30 pm.try to get there early to get seats. one can cross the ram jhula by foot or go by boat across the GANGA.the cost of the ticket is Rs 10 and the ticket booth is next to the car park,near chotiwala restaurant ram jhula. the last boat is at 7pm.

title: Unforgettable experience
review: So beautiful ..., and at same time everything so well organized. You could witness and/ or participate in evening Aarti or/ and Satsang. Incredible spiritual and physical experience, heaven and earth together. If you'll be in Rishikesh, don't miss this opportunity to visit Parmath Niketan.

title: Peacefull
review: The place is famous for the Aarti, people start flocking in to the place in the evening just to witness the Aarti which is performed here. It's soothing to the ears, its not noisy. U feel at peace on the banks of the river Ganga added with the Aarti. It's just a bliss.

title: Heavens - if one is to sum it up in a single word
review: Parmarth Niketan is a divine place to be.  Located right at the Banks of River Ganga, One could get the good glimpses of scenic natural beauty and offer prayers at the peaceful place.  I felt  alot of positive energy, while being there.

title: Someday I'll stay here
review: More than twice I travelled to Rishikesh in the hope that if there is vacancy I'll book myself here but in vain. They do take online bookings but my travel plans being last moment I just could not do this in advance. The one time I did book my room in advance, there was a festival happening at the ashram as well as a cloudburst happening in Rishikesh the same day I was supposed to reach there. So here I am on the road to Rishikesh with my family in the car, only to be told that due to the festival and the bad weather many guests did not leave and there was no chance of us getting a room with them.

title: A beautiful place on the bank of Ganges
review: This is beautiful temple/asram near the bank of river Ganges. The location and the overall architecture makes this place interesting and enjoyable.

title: Ganga Arati
review: We merge with ganga while the arati was goin on. My heart melt and i was floating deep in my heart.The song was so soothing and heavenly feelings. Swami and Saatvi was there it makes more heavenly as all the divine souls become ONE.

title: Excellent aarti
review: Come for the evening aarti but be early by an hour to grab the best seats - you will notice indian sadhus from the ashram getting up and giving their seats to foreigners who come late and that was very irritating and annoying

title: Ganga Aarti
review: My reason to like this place is because of Evening Ganga Aarti . Very neat and clean place (Ghat) . You will also see many foreign tourist . Soulful time on Aarti in a planned an proper manner . One must reach by 5 PM here . Joy full way to reach here is crossing the river by boat .

title: The biggest ashram on the trans Gangaa side
review: This ashram is famous for its evening aarti of maa gangaa. The aarti is really rich in Indian culture with lot of yong devotees of the ashram. The biggest attraction is the arrival of Chidanand Saraswati the founder of this ashram, who normally comes there. It is a great celebration in the evening and an added attraction for all the visitors to Rishikesh. You can reach there by crossing river from Ram Jhula and walk down. You cannot go in the car.

title: an evening surreal and sublime
review: the visit to Parmarth Ashram gave us insight into faith and godliness.The aarti conducted with so much faith and fervor makes one pause and wonder what we all are and where are we headed,

title: nice ashram
review: must visit ashram to stay. Ganges aarti sthal ismone of the mail stream. urban sip near ashram is a place to visit for coffee.

title: serene quite place on the banks of Ganga
review: This ashram and temple on the banks of River Ganga is perfect for people seeking inner peace and tranquility. The Ganga arti every evening is a beautiful experience and a must attend if you are in Rishikesh.

title: It's a second home for me
review: Ever since I stayed here 6 years earlier this has become my home away from home. I find solace, spiritual awakening, meeting yogi and hearing this wisdom, or just chilling. There is no pressure for a seeker here to seek or go into any rituals. Yet the place inspires freedom of movement and thinking. Do experience the evening ganga aarti. And enjoy the discourse of sadhavi Bhagwati  and pujya swami Chidanand Sataswati ji.

title: divine place
review: This ashram is located on the banks of river and has awesome silence and divinity inside. very nice place to make your holiday relaxing.

title: money making scam
review: went for the ganga arti here after hearing a lot about it but what a disapointment. the baba there seems to be only interested in making money in the name of religion and literally forces people to make donations. highly avoidable

title: relaxing evening Aarti
review: Its a mesmerizing evening Arti Experience, neat and clean place, well organised aarti, Wonderful place to visit, a must visit place for a peaceful experience.

title: GANGA AARTI EXPERIENCE
review: Visited Rishikesh from 13 to 15 July with family. Attended Ganga Aarti everyday. It was really a divine experience. Ambiance was really very good. One can feel peace in the vicinity. Everybody is involved in the aarti. Very very peaceful divine atmosphere. A must for Rishikesh visit. Planning to go there again and again.

title: Peaceful experience during evening Ganga aarti
review: Must do if you are in RIshikesh. The cleanliness, crowd and peace of Ganga aarti is in different league (people having done Ganga aarti at HarKi Pauri will appreciate this).

title: Beautiful Spiritual Place
review: This place holds the essence of Rishikesh.  It has the ganga, yoga, gurukul, and seekers from all around the world searching for the greater truth of life.

title: Commercialised
review: Had heard of this place a lot but it is over rated. The place is totally commercialized and not pure.

title: Avoidable
review: Had heard so much about arti here but what a let down. While it is an alright pastime but the whole thing smacks of money making and artificiality. Next time I would rather sit at a quieter spot next to Ganges.

title: Ok place
review: We went here for the evening aarti. Was quite a crowded place as one has to walk through narrow market lanes. The aarti was, unfortunately, washed out due to rain.. though from what we saw would recommend the aarti at Triveni ghat over this.

title: Very peaceful
review: Attended aarti...the whole aarti was mesmerizing...very peaceful and calm place...the chanting of mantras were in rhythm

title: The largest ashram in Rishikesh
review: Parmarth Niketan is the largest ashram in Rishikesh located on the banks of the River Ganges. Here one can feel clean, pure and sacred atmosphere. Here beautiful gardens are maintained by ashram. The daily activities at Parmarth Niketan include prayers, yoga and meditation classes, satsang, kirtan, the Ganga Aarti at sunset, Nature Cure and Ayurvedic treatment.

title: An oasis of peace in a busy area
review: There are several factors to Parmath Niketan. First is the excellent Ganga Aarti celebration each evening with terrific colour and music building a great atmosphere. It is very welcoming for everybody although has a greater spiritual significance for Hindus. However, the energy and atmosphere is terrific.

title: Peace
review: Temple name should be Shanti Temple. The place where you can relax and meditate. The place where you feel your internal feelings and soul.

title: Ganga Aarti at Parmarth Niketan
review: The Ganga aarti in the evening at Parmath Niketan is not to be missed since it is a real devine experience. It is a ceremony with singers playing bhajans and aarti live with everyone participating to chant bhajans and the arti along with the singers.One can hold the aarti lamp during the recitation and offer personal prayers to Ma Ganga.

title: Aarti Ghat
review: This is the Aarti Ghat place, very well maintained. Inside, there is lustre temple complex.Very huge ashramam with lot of greenery.

title: Watch the everyday fire ceremony at 7pm
review: Know more about hinduism visiting the ashram and go to their restaurant is nice to eat some cheap and delicious samosa at 4pm. The fire ceremony they do in the end of the day is nice to see as well

title: beautiful sunset ceremonies
review: during my stays in Rishikesh, I came here several times for the aarti at sunset. I loved the atmosphere at the river and the temple. one of my best experiences in Rishikesh

title: just near to the ganga aarti place
review: this temple is just next to the ganga aarti place.

title: Nice temple to explore. Nice scram beer by.
review: Good to explore, also they have artery ceremony here. The area is good to walk around, good restuarants and shops around.

title: Evening Ganga Ji Aarti !!
review: A must visit place with a must attend Ganga Ji Aarti is held every evening during sunset during at the Temple's Ghat. With so many people praying all together, there is a great environment you can't miss during your visit. You can dip your feets in the river and sit on the steps of the Ghat and relax there.

title: Heavenly Abode
review: I went there it was my birthday .Aarti was about to start ,I donot want anything above this .It was so peaceful and harmonious and never enjoy my birthday in my life so much, chanting Shree Hanuman Chalisa .Wow it was so so blissful,I advice families and friends even couple to go and feel this positive atmosphere of Shree Parmaath Niketan Ashram.Nice location to visit .Heartiest Thanks and respect to the Singers Wow i donot have words to express this experience

title: A central spiritual place not to be missed
review: Very nice gardens to enjoy freshness on a warm day. The ashram is open to the public to a certain extent (some statues are getting renovated). Very nice fire ceremony at sunset.

title: Ganga aarti - heavenly
review: This is a must do for all travellers - the serenity of the locale is accentuated by the divinely rendering of the bhajans and aarti during sunset

title: Evening Aarti is one of the main highlights of Rishikesh
review: Don't miss evening aarti here. The pandit boys and Muni Ji give a sweet performance. Much more polished than the trivenin ghat aarti. You can hear the chanting from all around swarm ashram and muni ki reti.

title: Aarti for people who are sophisticated
review: Experience is great. Lots of gurus follower including foreigners.

title: ganga aarti
review: such a peaceful place for the holy spirit people who love to walk down in a inner soul and achieve something for their own self.. i have attended the ganga arty over there nothing could be much happier and satisfiers than that :)

title: Best evening Aarti
review: Parmarth niketan is one of the best place to see in rishikesh. There are lot of rooms to stay and very good compus with gardens and fountains.The evening ganga aarti is quite famous here and is performed by the head of parmarth niketan sarswati ji maharaj  with thousands of devotees with songs and musics. Daily havan(yaggya) is also performed . Very spiritual place to see and rest.

title: Should be more organised
review: Attended the evening prayers by the river. 10 min walk from Ram Jhula, through narrow lanes, small shops. While the hype started one hour before with hundreds of people sitting since 6PM in the heat, once the prayer started eventually at 7PM, there was utter chaos with everyone trying to get hold of the lights and click a selfie. Though it should last for one hour, many people started leaving after the selfie was clicked. It could have been more organised, and it would be much better.

title: An amazing place to stay
review: Parmarth Niketan is a wonderful experience. If one wishes to practise yoga, retreat orstay or to visit or to attend Ganga Aarti in the evenings, it is the perfect location.
