title: Enjoy one of the Best Arti
review: I gone to Parmarth after my friends recommendation and I found them right. Go in evening by 6 to Parmarth , stay their for 1.5 hours , Enjoy Bhajans, Ganga and Arti. You will feel Peace, Spiritual and Refreshed. Must go Place.

title: The Evening Arti
review: Parmarth Niketan is a five minutes walk from Ram Jhoola. It is a beautiful Ashram, with rooms for as cheap as 600 INR a night. The evening prayers here is the main attraction for everyone who comes to Rishikesh.

title: Very peaceful and calm place
review: Very good ashram...Must enjoy a dip in Ganga...Their ghats are clean and safe for bathing...It also had very scenic garden..

title: Beautiful experience
review: Attended the evening aarti at the Parmarth Niketan. It was a beautiful soulful experience. Reach there at least by 6 pm to get the best seats. Might be a little uncomfortable for small kids as the whole event goes on till beyond 7.30 pm.

title: Peaceful & Spiritual
review: We are there to experience the evening Arti. It was a blissful experience. Very well done. Clean and not very crowded.

title: Don't miss the Ganga Aarti here in the evening
review: The temple is clean, well maintained.

title: Very organized
review: Would definitely recommend the Parmarth Ganga aarti to Triveni Ghat aarti, it is much cleaner, organized & performance of the priests better, the only drawback is the walking distance from the main city to the Parmarth ghat across not recommended for elderly who have difficulty in walking, or can drive on the opposite bank from Barrage.

title: Most Famous aarti at rishikesh
review: Temple is famous for the Ganga Aarti. Visited this place second time with friends. Here a statue of God Shiva used to be there 2 years back but now due to flood the statue is no more there but the aarti was still like it was used to happen 2 years back.

title: spiritual tour
review: a well managed center as it is a private org.we reached there at evening ganga arti the chanting of mantras,different bhajans before the aarti really creates a divine atmosphere.

title: Beautiful aarti...
review: I had heard a lot about the Parmarth Niketan evening aarti on the banks of Ganges. So while visiting Rishikesh last week , we decided to go for it one evening as we were staying in a hotel in Shivpuri. Want to give a few inputs regarding this event. If you are not staying in the Swargashram area of Rishikesh, it is a good 25 mins walk to reach PN from the car parking near Ram Jhula. The actual Aarti doesn't start until about 7:30, but there is a whole programme if havan, chantings, bhajans prior to it which lead to the aarti. Good time to reach would be around 5:30 and take a place from where the central stairs are clearly visible. Usually there is a huge crowd of visitors wanting to witness the event so the earlier you reach the better else you will get a place to stand at quite some distance from where you will not be able to see much. It's bang on the banks of the holy Ganges and I found the whole experience really ethereal. It hugely adds to the essence of a place like Rishikesh.

title: Beautiful old ashram
review: I visited the ashram just walking around one sunny afternoon and it was beautiful. Myself and my friend very much enjoyed the gardens and pretty architecture.

title: Ganga aarti in full tradition
review: Parmarth Ganga aarti in the evening is a tradition by itself and a must see for the foreigners and the first timers. The tradition at its best. Timing from 5.45 pm till 6.45 pm. Should try to reach there by 5.30 pm to get a proper seat. The experience of aarti on the banks of the river Ganga is so surreal and  quite mystifying.

title: Huge Complex
review: This temple on Ram Jhula is a huge complex with small temple inside and provides accommodation to large number of Yogis and Travelers passing by.

title: One of the best things I did in Rishikesh
review: Visited the temple for Aarti which is a must do experience. Head to the pannel right after Aarti to ask any spiritual journey questions you have or simple listen to the wisdom provided. Once in a lifetime experience.

title: Nice grounds, mediocre atmosphere
review: This is a big touristy spot.  Not a bad thing, just good to have that awareness.  The dormitory room was ok, spacious with a little kitchen and sink that was a nice touch.  The grounds have lots of nice topiary and statuary, though are a little staid.  Everything seemed hushed.  The staff at the canteen didn't seem happy to be there, and weren't friendly.  While there's chanting and prayers and kirtan at 5 am, which was very nice, and yoga later in the day, note that there is nothing else in the daily schedule, compared to nearby places that offer a full ashram experience.  The aarti is a big attraction; if you go early, around 5 pm when it starts, you'll hear some very nice melodic kirtan before the more discursive/talking side of the ceremony.  Overall, it didn't feel like there was much if any community here, at least for the casual visitor like myself.

title: Quite atmosphere
review: Aarti is big attraction at this place. You will hear very melodic kirtan at his place. to occupy better place to witness aarti You should try to reach this place by 5.30 pm. The experience of aarti in the holy banks of the river Ganga is very mystifying.

title: Nothing but propaganda
review: I love religious places but this place seems to be full of propaganda with talks of money and donations, fancily dressed pundits chanting some mantras only to attract more 'customers'. I would not recommend it to anyone seeking peace and religious experience. Ganga aartis at Rishikesh and Haridwar are a hundred times more pure.

title: Best Ganga Aarti in Rishikesh
review: Parmarth Niketan conducts daily Ganga Aarti in the evening on the bank of river Ganga. This is by far he best Aarti that takes place in Rishikesh for the reason that it is very colourful, musical and held on a large scale with live telecast being done on various TV channels.

title: Ganga Aarti
review: Must watch Ganga Aarti it was splendid although very cold but the big divas for Aarti lit up the area. Bhajans were excellent as that day birthday of Hinduja brothers was being celebrated and lot of members from their family were present.

title: Overpriced massage, overpriced rooms and all around dirty.
review: For the price you're paying for a room you'd expect something a bit nicer but it's pretty basic and dirty.

title: Don't miss the sunset aarti.
review: It's a mesmerizing experience which should not be missed. Make sure to reach before sunset, experience the aarti and stay there till sunset. Experience the divinity.

title: Boring architecture, run-down.
review: I just can't figure out why anyone would want to come to this place.No one takes care of anything. Yes, they slopped on a coat of paint this Feb and March but it's still a mess. Ashrams here also never clean. Disgusting. As much as I used to love Rishikesh, I'm done.

title: Spiritual mecca
review: From the moment my travel partner and walked through the gate of Parmarth Niketan I felt right at home. The grounds are meticulously kept. The rooms are simple ..but ours was perfect . Mornings begin with Satsang in the Satsang Hall and are open but not mandatory.  Walk in Yoga classes are offered twice a day. Yoga courses are offered as well. The beautiful Evening Aarti is held every evening as the sun sets , with in steps of the front gate right on the Ganga. The market is just conveniently just a few steps away. Three Thali style meals are served a day in the canteen for just a few rupeed.I plan to spend as much time as possible at Parmarth Niketan . Planning to return in fall for volunteer program and Ayurveda program offered on site. Being a guest at Parmarth Niketan is a blessing.

title: Nice ashram near Triveni ghat !!
review: The Parmath Niketan ashram is located very close to the Triveni ghat. The ambiance is nice and soothing. The ashram has a replica of the Lakshman & Ram jhula. There is also a natural Ganesh idol formed in between a tree.

title: Beautiful and peaceful !
review: I saw the ganga aarti . At this time of the year international yoga festival was going on . There was a lot of crowd who chanted and sang the aarti . There are a lot of foreign tourists in this place. The Aarti and the temples are beautiful .

title: Great
review: Visited this place suring international yoga festival organised by hindu heritage foundation. Was part of HHF team. Great people and awesome atmosphere. Lot of foreigners and sivamani performed on stage. Felt like living there for ever. Temple was nice on d banks of river ganga. Neat and clean. Well maintained. Well organised and managed. They have fot rooms to stay also. Well done parmarth niketan.

title: Site of International Yoga Festival 2016
review: Well-organized great festival on the 1st week of March 1-8, 2016.  The sessions were run by some very special people.  The ashram is right on the river and can be a bit noisy at night.  The rooms are sparse but well-designed.

title: beautifull place
review: Did the yoga festival there, very nicely organized... it is a gorgeous ashram , very well maintained allthough it is very big.

title: ONE OF THE BEST ASHRAMS ON THE GANGES
review: Each nite at 6pm, is a very sweet arathi, prayers at the banks of the ganges. also, have nice accomodations and very sweet swami is in charge. rooms are basic and food is very good. also have an ayuvedic massage area. lots of yoga and workshops always taking place. good place to visit and stay.

title: Very Peaceful
review: We visited there first time in the evening after aarti the crowd was nice and very decent. We had dinner in the canteen food was really delicious and cooked in pure Ghee(Gesi Ghee) and without onion & Garlic.

title: Excellent for it evening Aarti
review: I remember visiting this temple the first time to Rishikesh....and i couldn't stop crying! i have no clue why i was crying but it def wasn't in pain... i felt i was living every moment of my life there with love..its just one of the best moments to sit by the holy ganga and hear a whole lot of people..young old..indians. and from around the world...chanting all together...its simply magical...

title: Peaceful & simple
review: This place should be on top list when you are visiting Rishikesh.

title: Nice aarti
review: This temple is located on the other side of rishikesh haridwar road on bank of river ganges. One can have aarti in the evening on ganges ghat

title: Temples in a single premise
review: This is good for religious travelers. There are lot of small shops selling local products, ayurvedic products, sundry items, handicrafts and food items around it. The main attraction is the "Ganga Arti" which happens every evening.

title: Wonderful evening time...
review: The evening aarti in this place would provide you peace which is unexplainable. Do visit to the place. Its near to the Geeta Ashram. Wonderful place to visit. Really peaceful experience...

title: Don't miss it when in Rishikesh
review: It is located close to Ram Jhula on the baks of Holy Ganga.. It is one of the best place to visit in Rishikesh. It is very well maintained and the ambience is very calm and peaceful. One must see  Ganga Aarti in the evening performed by children with their Guruji. Unlike Haridwar nobody coerce here to donate money. Worth seeing.

title: Amazing Ganga Aarti
review: Whenever I'm in Rishikesh and I want to watch the Ganga Aarti, I love to visit the Parmarth  Niketan Temple and sit down and watch the aarti being performed there. The place itself is very neat and the aarti is organised well with young monks performing the aarti and singing with it. It is also a photographers delight to watch them perform the aarti.

title: Most popular show in town
review: Every night Paramarth puts on an impressive river worship puja aarti at dusk. Pandits sing and havan fires burn. Muni Ji, the head of the ashram has a remarkable history of meditation and austerities, and promotes spiritual and environmental initiatives.

title: Very well located, neat, clean well disciplined.
review: Went around the ashram, it requires advance booking and difficult yo get accommodation if you just walk in.

title: must go
review: must must go place.  during aarti it is just too awesome.  very friendly crowd.  well maintained.  well organised.

title: Exceeded Expectations
review: Attended aarti and walked around the grounds but did not stay at Parmath Niketan. I expected the aarti to be cheesy since it is such a big production but it was actually quite nice and very joyous. The grounds are beautiful and there is a really well-maintained cow sanctuary on site. Staff, guests, and residents at the ashram all seemed very happy.

title: Ok, I"m biased--I"m in seva here.
review: I've had many people tell me that this is the cleanest ashram in Rishikesh.  We offer free yoga classes and every evening there is Ganga aarti, which if you've never been, you must attend!  Afterward, when Pujya Swamiji and Sadhviji are in residence, there is satsang and darshan.  The clarity of the answers to the questions is phenomenal.

title: Ganga, Spirituality and Peace of mind
review: You should go here once on an evening to see the aarti. The atmosphere is very spiritual and peaceful.

title: serene and peaceful place...
review: place is very appealing and soothing for business travellers like me..  cheap as well. staff nearby was great..

title: Evening havan and aarti is an absolute must!!
review: The best experience of my whole trip to India. It is so blissful and beautiful. If you get a chance go through at around 4pm to be in time for havan, bhajans and aarti. It's over by 6.30pm.

title: Visit their Evening Puja
review: Nice place to relax yourself during the sunset go there around 5pm relax with your foot on the ganga river and enjoy the evening aarti(puja).

title: Nice place to get connected
review: Its nice to be at Parmarth for Aarti, students all around are really performing good and maintaining that standard for everyone on everyday basis. I been to this place several times and always like to spent evening for Aarti.

title: holy place on the bank of river Ganges!
review: while taking part in the aarti of Ganges one can take Darshan of the the temple. Hanuman temple of the campus is beatifully constructed.

title: I didn't feel no Spiritualism nor help but Money
review: I decided to stay in the ashram cause a friend of mine lives there part time. Honestly, the stuff was not helpful at all, the rooms where sad, the library was closed, the buffet was poorly done. The gardens were ok, but way too many tourists for the ashram to feel peaceful and righteous.

title: Be here for Evening Ganga arti.
review: The place is well built and well maintained. The place is just so near to mother ganga and nature that the whole feeling itself is awesome. The evening ganga arti is best I have seen at any place. Overall enriching experience.

title: Stay if you want simple no frills
review: They won't let you see the rooms in advance,, and the one I got was pretty depressing and marginally clean. It is an Ashram, so I know it is basic, but I did feel with all the staff and volunteers, it could be spruced up a bit. Repairs, paint, etc...The place is worth taking a peek at just for the various colorful statues , and going down to the Ganges at sunset for chanting.

title: Best Ganga aarti possible!
review: This si the best and most genuine aarti-soulful singing by the Parmarth ashram students and really non commercial. Would highly recommend this.

title: Well Packaged Religon
review: Parmarth niketan is one of the famous ashrams of Rishikesh.Headed by the versatile Muniji as its spiritual head it gives religion a new twist.Located on the banks of the Ganga actually in Lakshmanjhula i.e the other side across the ganga it offers accommodation to suit all pockets.The ashram is run very professional by a team handpicked by Muniji and headed by foreigners using the latest technology.Its worth a visit to see how successful packaged religion has become in India

title: Parmath Niketan...after Crossing Ram Jhula
review: Only Best place to stay ...other than asharam...cross the ram jhula...and  these place is 10min walking from there....Only option is Online Booking....

title: Ganga Aarti- Superb
review: this is the best place to take part in the evening aarti, very clean, very well organised, in a great atmosphere on the banks of the Ganga, adjoining the Ashram. I went to the ashram twice in the two evenings I was there, and was mesmerized by the way it was all done. The bhajans and the Aarti really make you want to sit there for ever.

title: Holy place
review: We got a chance to attend the Ganga aarti here and yeah,we were definitely mesmerised. A large groups of boys along with the pandits performed the rituals.

title: Great for evening aarti!
review: I am an atheist..so just went there to see the evening aarti.

title: Peace and Happiness
review: visited this place during our trip to Rishikesh. We have been to Ganga Aarti in the evening organized by Parmarth Niketan. Its very good. They maintain very cleanliness and ensure no waste flows in river Ganges. they don't even throw a single flower in Ganges. The Swami g Preaches for cleanliness and gives a huge support in keeping the river Ganges clean. good to see all that.

title: ganga aarti at parmath ashram ghaat
review: the ganag aarti starts around 5:45pm and is performed on the ghaat infornt of parmath temple...the ghaat gives full view of rishikesh and on right side there is ram jhula....the aarti is not as spectacular as that of triveni ghaat but the experience is again very divine.. this is also a must visit experience

title: A Must Visit !
review: You can attend Ganda Aarti at 6 PM at this place and it is must to attend at your visit to Rishikesh. We visited Rishikesh on 31st and attended evening aarti here. I would suggest to visit at this place at 5 PM so that you would get proper and best place to have aarti by your own. They share Aarti thali (plate) to everyone . And you can also enjoy bhajan from 5 PM - 6 PM.

title: GANGA AARATI
review: We enjoyed ganga aarati there.Young boys perform bhajans and kirtans. They also chant mantras. It makes the environment really pleasant.

title: Back in Rishikesh
review: This is the best Aarti I have ever seen. One cannot miss this if he is in Rishikesh. Mesmerising Ganga flow along with Aarti & dhun you will not forget in your life.

title: Dirty overpriced rooms
review: I stayed 1night here for 600 rps because it includes 2 yoga classes per day. But then I found out that to drop in the classes you don't have to stay there. Classes are free for any body. As other places offer too.

title: A must visit at Rishikesh
review: Nicely maintained, neat and clean...Calm atmosphere...On the banks of Ganga...The Shiva idol is splendid

title: Beautiful property
review: Really lovely gardens and statues. Most famous aarti in Rishikesh and a must see while you visit .. Too bad the giant Shive statue was swept away by the flood

title: Nice Gardens, Quite Indian
review: Nice place to visit with a guru that reminds me of king julien from Madagascar... nice yoga groups and people and gardens.  Statues are a bit tacky and look like spiritual garden gnomes.

title: Excellent ashram on banks of ganges
review: Besides beautiful evening arathi every nite, they have beautiful grounds, nice rooms,may undid massage, daily yoga and discourses. Especially when swami is in resident. Ask for sadvigi for special introduction,she is excellent source of knowledge and compassion.recommend this for solo travelers on the path

title: Go there for the evening Aarti!!
review: Evening aarti was very good and soothing. As compared to Har ki pauri aarti in Haridwar, it was much less crowded and the chants were mesmerizing. Worth a visit.

title: Peaceful
review: We have spent few relaxing minutes sitting on the bench in a nice, clean garden without being bothered by vendors or children selling flowers.  Most likely the cleanest spot in the town. After that we have wondered trough the ashram looking for some info on yoga and possible stay on the next trip. We did not find any-I guess we did not look very hard or in the right places.

title: Calm & Serene Place
review: Nice place to visit. Evening aarti is very good and soothing.... nice grounds, yoga groups and people and gardens.

title: Wonderful place to stay and relax
review: Nice clean place for a relaxing experience. We were there for 2 days and nights to enjoy the Ganga Aarti and family get together.

title: Holiday at rishikesh
review: Stayed for 2 nights just next to Laxmanjhula a unique hanging bridge.

title: Definetly Go
review: One of the biggest and prettiest temle complexes in the heart of Rishikesh. If you're already there, stay for the Ganga aarti.

title: Blissful Gangaji
review: Melodious Aarti. However the ashram is located little far away from Ram Jhula. Dont miss out to check on the Chotiwale Baba on your way to the ashram.

title: Spiritual and peaceful
review: Great experience! Started from 6pm sunset time and finished about 6:40pm.  Spiritual music played on traditional Indian instruments. Divine moment.

title: Divine place with spirituality all around
review: Divine place with spirituality all around. Was fortunate to attend the evening aarti conducted near clock tower.

title: Spacious ashram
review: Spacious simple rooms. The ashram has a dedicated Ganga ghat, hence taking a dip in the holy Ganga is not a problem. One (especially ladies), can even take a dip in the Ganga and then get to the room and change.

title: Peaceful and spacious
review: Nice place to spend time alone. The room is simple and fine with the infra well built for different parts of spiritual occasions.

title: Evening aarti is good experience (though targetted towards foreigners mostly) and soothing bhajan t
review: Very neat ashram, pretty large and excellent canteen - Clean and healthy food at very reasonable price. Evening Ganga aarti is a must to attend event. As an Indian, you may feel ashamed seeing how the foreign tourists sincerely offer prayers to Ganga. Breathtaking views fro Ganga aarti platform and you will be mesmerized seeing the magnificent Ganga mayya!

title: Lord Shiva statue
review: Nice to visit with many temples inside and also many statues of Lords telling old stories. Lotus flowers can also be found inside

title: Must watch the arti here
review: The arti that is held every morning and evening here is a must visit. It is held at the ghat in front of the ashram and has to be experienced. There are rooms available for those who wish to stay but they are in need of serious maintainence. If you do not mind dark ill lighted rooms and dripping taps, you should stay at the place.

title: Divine
review: The aarti har har ganga. Ananda guests are taken to and fro with a guide who helps you thru and it is the most amazing sight for ananda guests, you can do the aarti yourself. must do.

title: Aarti, Hollywood style!
review: We were lucky in that we had a private audience with the No 2 with lovely tea & biscuits. We were a big group from Navdanya & went for the evening Aarti.

title: Holy spiritual place to stay.
review: A holy place at swargashram, rishikesh. It is famous for Ganga Aarti n many celebrities which attend this place n take spiritual guidance from Muni Ji.

title: Great Place for a quite and spiritual sojourn on the bank of Ganges
review: I visited this place in July 2015. The purpose of the visit was to spend some quite time on the bank of Ganges. It is located very near to Ram Jhula which is approximately 25 kms from Haridwar station. In the backdrop of the ashram is a mountain. Since it was July, Ganges was in its full spirit and you can always hear the flow of water, if you have taken a river facing room. There is a canteen inside the ashram which is open from morning till 11pm and serves simple nutritious food at economic rates (Lunch and Dinner @ Rs.60). The room tariffs are also economical. The ashram is dotted with mythological idols of Lord Shiva and Lord Vishnu and his various avatars. The special attraction is the Ganga Aarti which happens everyday at 6pm. The bank of Ganges is also well made and you can safely take a dip even if the water current is high.

title: Divine Experience.
review: What an experience of the Ganga aarti at the ashram.the bhajans and chanting start at 6pm and the aarti at 7pm.The whole experience of sitting by the Ganga flowing near you with the beautiful diyas and loud chanting  by all the ashram inmates and the crowd joining in is initself a Divine Experience.

title: devine experience
review: Ganga Aarti in the evening is a must attend here, the environment is so pious songs and hymns chaned by the parmarth Niketan students followed by the Aarti.

title: Aarti
review: Evening Aarti is a blissful, soulful experience. A must for all travellers. In the heart of the city with nice boutique shops & famous Chotiwala resteraunt

title: Very sirene
review: The Aarti was very good and certainly felt very very calm!! I expected it to be very crowded like on TV but it was relatively quite less.

title: A once in a lifetime experience
review: This temple has the most beautiful view of the Ganges. Just sitting on the footsteps of the ghat and watching the ganges gushing by is such a serene feeling that touches your soul. The gange Aarti done at 6 pm is truly a divine experience. A must visit.

title: A Well maintained Place
review: A Not to be missed attraction in Rishikesh close to Raam Jhuls. The Place is very clean divine and has beautiful gardens.Has a Good canteen.

title: Best spiritual vibe
review: It was the second experience of performing the fire sacrifice alongside the Ganges and the experience is spectacular.

title: Slowly but gradually updating themselves
review: Evening Aarti was divine & the best part was about non VIP's/common people who were made party by giving/offering them the Aarti diya (Big one - used in these Aarti's). This act was one of it's own kind.

title: Truly Majestic, Divine & Calm
review: I was there with my whole family and it was Divine, Divine and Divine. It was so simple and beautiful, Ganga Ghat at Aarti I can’t express in words, you can just feel it. It was an hour affair started with the Ganesh Vandana, Shiv Aradhana, few bhajans, Hanuman Chalisa and then Maa Ganga Aarti. The whole ambience is so pure, that you will drop all your impurities in Ganga and will come out with pure heart.

title: Religious Place
review: This is a very nice and religious place on the Bank of Ganges in Rishikesh. One has to cross the Ganges either through Ram Jhula or by Boats to go to other side.

title: Spritual experience
review: It is near Ram Jhula and provides a beautiful view of the Ganges. The ghat is clean and the aarti in the evening is a spritual experience.

title: Peace and beauty makes difference
review: This is a mix of things: temple, ashram, place for couses and events, etc

title: Ganga Arati
review: Ganga Arati was awesome! Beautiful rendering of the hanuman chalisa, Mritunjaya mantra, shanti mantras and Ganga arati with several lit lamps being passed on to one another. Swamiji engaged in a meaningful & inspiring talk.

title: Ganga Aarti Touches Your Heart
review: Its really good place to visit in morning and evening at Ganga Aarti time. Lot of people gathers together for Aarti both evening and morning time. Its provokes religious feeling of your heart and lead you towards peace of mind.

title: Yoga Ashram
review: A very pretty ashram with a mediocre guru and a lot of quite repressed looking swami's.  The gardens are beautiful and pretty and well maintained.  The accommodation is well priced.

title: Well maintained!!
review: This is a very well maintained place. I went to see the evening Arti, which was soothing and good. A lot of greenery maintained. It is good place for yoga also.

title: Bliss
review: Love this place! So easy to be in bhakti(devotion) here. The evening aarthi is magnificent ! And access to Ganga is right there! So perfect for anyone wanting to concentrate on their yoga. Food is clean and simple and fresh. They also provide filtered water and hot water. It is an ashram living though,so don't expect luxury. Very simple and basic accommodations. The staff were very helpful to me and I will never forget them. Love this place!

title: Serene!!
review: The most relaxing experience. The 6.30 pm Aarti is simply serene and calms oneself. Its definitely a must do thing when you visit rishikesh.

title: One of best places in Rishikesh
review: Parmarth Niketan temple is very nice. Whenever we visit Rishikesh, we always go there. Remarkable thing is evening prayer and Ganga Aarti. Everyone present during Ganga Aarti gets a chance to perform the aarti by themselves as temple provides many diyas for aarti.

title: Nice experience
review: The music sung by the students was very well sung. We were treated like special folks, and got to do the aarti. A  simple prayer in heart is enough, but good to experience what is a daily ritual.

title: Holidays in Rishikesh
review: We went for Aarti at Sunset. Full atmosphere was divine. Divine song was  being played before actual aarti begins. Many local young students in oranges were part of pooja before aarti. Many aarti thali distributed so that everyone got chance to perform it. One should not miss this if in Rishikesh. I will recommend to do it everyday as long as you are there in Rishikesh.

title: Ganga Aaarti at its best in Rishikesh
review: Walking distance from Ram Jhula situated its a very calm, peaceful, clean ghat where one can easily enjoy Ganga aarti not only by seeing but by also performing it along with the rituals, holy chants done by the priests.

title: International Yoga festival
review: Wonderful and enlightening....a must see to understand a "working Ashram"   A school and meditation retreat that embodies the essence of Yoga and good work ..Seva!

title: You MUST experience this Aarti
review: This Aarti is very intimate because the young men bring the aarti out into the crowd and people have the opportunity to hold and move the flames with them.  The chanting and singing are beautiful, and the golden light of evening created the most magical experience.  Go early to get a seat on the steps at river's edge.  And you can buy the offerings from children on the street--flowers, candle, incense, and red tumeric.  Incredible.

title: No need to stay at the Ashram to go to the Saatsang and daily Sunset Aarti
review: Every day at 6 pm, you can watch the ceremony of Suriya Aarti (Sunset Blessing).

title: Spiritually motivated
review: Parmarth Nikaten is very famous place of Rishikesh for spiritual activity. Yoga, Ganga darshan,Ganga Arati are main attractions. Situated on the left bank of Ganga river. Some years ago Lord Shiva statue is constructed along or in the deeply submerged area of left bank  creates beautiful view or spiritual view for meditation or worship.

title: Visited Ashram during Rishikesh Stay
review: The ashram is the largest in Rishikesh and it works for many social causes including cleaning of Ganges river under the Namami Ganges initiative. The Ashram also has around 1000 rooms for visitors and if someone wants to stay here then they can send in the request by applying online on the ashram's website.

title: If you're in Rishikesh it's a must really!
review: Come here to watch the sun setting on the Ganga river - it is simply incredible and a fantastic way to be welcomed (and also say goodbye) to Rishikesh.

title: Nice Place to visit
review: One of the best peaceful place in Rishikesh, everyone should go there for yoga and meditation. this place is famous globally

title: Amazing experience
review: Very spiritual and interesting chanting on Ganga river side. We spend amazing evening and would like to come back.

title: Quiet and peaceful
review: The Aarti here is very beautiful, less number of people attend here, so you will be able to attend it in a better way.

title: Peace place
review: Excellent get up. Very sombre ambience. Kitchen serves very tasty food at very affordable rate to everyone. Rooms are very clean, modestly decorated and priced reasonably. Booking done on line. Popular among tourists both National and International. Gangs artist in the evening is a real crowd puller. Must stay while in Rishikesh. Provision stores are available with good stock.

title: Definitely a place to visit
review: The temple is on the side of the Ganges and is a must see. It is full of mythology and Some great statues. It is locatied next to the Ganges and is in a busy areia where there is a lot of action going on.

title: evening aarti
review: the most remarkable experience of visiting rishikesh is the evening ganga aarti on parmath niketan temple ghats.

title: Very good
review: Situated on the bank of river Ganga ,this is a famous spot for the famous Ganga Aarti . Quite serene and peaceful spot . A few good temples here are very nice . Lots of activities keep on happening here . A must visit

title: Spiritually motivated
review: Parmarth Nikaten is very famous place of Rishikesh for spiritual activity. Yoga, Ganga darshan,Ganga Arati are main attractions. Situated on the left bank of Ganga river.
